required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Prospective Randomized Clinical Trial of Intravenous Lipids and Cholestasis
clinical_study.official_title: Effect of Lipid Intake on Direct Hyperbilirubinemia in Late Preterm and Term Infants With Gastrointestinal Surgical Problems.

brief_summary.textblock: The Investigators hypothesize that increased cumulative amount of lipid intake causes PNAC in late preterm and term neonates with major GI surgical disorders

study_design_info.masking_description: The care taker team provided daily weight to the research pharmacist for calculating the dose of the lipid according to the assignment and then calculated the rate of administration over 18 to 24 hours depending on the volume. The rate and dose was masked to the investigators and participants.

primary_outcome.measure: Parenteral Nutrition Associated Cholestasis will be the primary outcome measure and will be defined as direct bilirubin ≥ 2mg/dl developing within one week of the completion of 6 week randomization period

secondary_outcome.measure: Rate of increase in direct bilirubin
